experiments.title: Transcriptional Adaptation of Yeast (Saccharomyces cerevisiae) to Hypogravity Conditions
experiments.summary: Detailed analysis of gene expression and metabolic pathway changes in yeast exposed to simulated microgravity, focusing on core stress response mechanisms.
experiments.description: Comprehensive study of how the single-celled fungus *Saccharomyces cerevisiae* adapts its growth patterns, gene expression, and energy utilization in zero-gravity environments, supporting long-term biological stability in space.

experiments.title: Advanced Plant Growth Systems for Long-Duration Space Missions
experiments.summary: Investigation of optimal growing conditions for various crop species in controlled environment agriculture systems aboard the ISS.
experiments.description: This experiment evaluates multiple plant species including lettuce, tomatoes, and peppers using NASA's Advanced Plant Habitat to determine best practices for sustainable food production in space.

experiments.title: Cellular Response to Cosmic Radiation in Mammalian Tissue
experiments.summary: Analysis of DNA damage and repair mechanisms in mammalian cells exposed to galactic cosmic rays and solar particle events.
experiments.description: Long-term study examining how cosmic radiation affects cellular processes, with focus on cancer risk assessment and development of protective countermeasures for astronauts.

experiments.title: Biofilm Formation Patterns in Microgravity Environments
experiments.summary: Study of bacterial biofilm development and antibiotic resistance in space conditions.
experiments.description: Investigation of how microgravity affects bacterial colony formation, biofilm architecture, and antimicrobial susceptibility with implications for spacecraft hygiene and astronaut health.

experiments.title: Bone Density Loss and Countermeasures in Extended Microgravity
experiments.summary: Comprehensive analysis of skeletal system changes during long-duration spaceflight and evaluation of exercise protocols.
experiments.description: Multi-year study tracking bone mineral density changes in astronauts and testing various exercise regimens and nutritional interventions to mitigate bone loss.

experiments.title: Photosynthetic Efficiency Under LED Spectrum Optimization
experiments.summary: Testing various LED light spectra to maximize photosynthetic efficiency and crop yield in space agriculture systems.
experiments.description: Experimental evaluation of different wavelength combinations and light intensities to optimize plant growth rates and nutritional content for space-grown crops.

experiments.title: Immune System Adaptation During Long-Duration Spaceflight
experiments.summary: Longitudinal study of immune function changes in astronauts during extended missions.
experiments.description: Comprehensive immunological profiling examining T-cell function, antibody production, and inflammatory responses throughout multi-month space missions.

experiments.title: Microalgae Cultivation for Oxygen Production and Carbon Sequestration
experiments.summary: Development of photobioreactor systems using microalgae for life support applications in space habitats.
experiments.description: Testing various microalgae species for optimal oxygen production, CO2 removal, and potential food/fuel production in closed-loop life support systems.

experiments.title: Genetic Expression Changes in Drosophila Across Multiple Generations
experiments.summary: Multi-generational study of fruit flies examining genetic adaptations to space environment.
experiments.description: Long-term experiment tracking genetic changes, developmental patterns, and evolutionary adaptations in fruit fly populations bred entirely in microgravity.

experiments.title: Microgravity Protein Crystallization for Drug Development
experiments.summary: Growing high-quality protein crystals in microgravity for pharmaceutical research applications.
experiments.description: Utilizing microgravity conditions to produce larger, more ordered protein crystals enabling better structural analysis for drug design and disease research.

experiments.title: Cardiovascular System Remodeling in Microgravity
experiments.summary: Study of heart function and blood vessel changes during extended spaceflight.
experiments.description: Comprehensive cardiovascular monitoring examining cardiac output, blood pressure regulation, and vascular remodeling in astronauts during long-duration missions.

experiments.title: Root Architecture and Nutrient Uptake in Microgravity
experiments.summary: Analysis of plant root system development and mineral absorption efficiency in space conditions.
experiments.description: Detailed study of how microgravity affects root branching patterns, gravitropism, and nutrient transport mechanisms in various crop species.

experiments.title: Circadian Rhythm Disruption and Sleep Quality in Space
experiments.summary: Investigation of sleep patterns and circadian clock function during spaceflight.
experiments.description: Monitoring astronaut sleep quality, circadian gene expression, and testing light-based countermeasures to maintain healthy sleep-wake cycles in space.

experiments.title: Fungal Pathogen Virulence in Spaceflight Conditions
experiments.summary: Study of how microgravity affects fungal pathogen behavior and infection potential.
experiments.description: Examining changes in fungal virulence factors, growth rates, and antifungal drug susceptibility in space environment with implications for crew health.

experiments.title: 3D Tissue Engineering in Microgravity for Regenerative Medicine
experiments.summary: Development of three-dimensional tissue constructs using microgravity conditions.
experiments.description: Creating complex tissue structures including cardiac tissue and organoids in microgravity, leveraging the absence of gravity for improved cell organization.

experiments.title: Wheat Growth and Grain Production for Space Agriculture
experiments.summary: Complete life cycle study of wheat from seed to harvest in space conditions.
experiments.description: First attempt to grow wheat through complete reproductive cycle in space, evaluating grain yield, nutritional quality, and viability for long-term space missions.
